QSeries¶

A QSeries represents a formal power series with sparse rational coefficients, truncated at a specified order \(N\). Coefficients are returned as fractions.Fraction objects for exact arithmetic.

QSeries supports arithmetic (+, -, *), coefficient access via series[k], and LaTeX rendering in Jupyter notebooks via _repr_latex_().

class q_kangaroo.QSeries¶

A q-series (formal power series) with sparse rational coefficients.

Supports coefficient access via series[k] (returns a Python Fraction), arithmetic operations (+, *, -, unary -), and string display in the REPL.

`python s = QSession() e = etaq(s, 1, 1, 20) print(e)          # '1 - q + q^2 + ...' print(e[0])       # Fraction(1, 1) print(len(e))     # number of nonzero coefficients `

coeffs()¶

Iterate over nonzero coefficients, returning list of (power, Fraction) tuples.

degree()¶

Highest nonzero exponent (degree), or None if zero series.

invert()¶

Multiplicative inverse: 1 / self

is_zero()¶

True if all coefficients are zero (the zero series).

latex()¶

LaTeX string without dollar-sign wrappers.

low_degree()¶

Lowest nonzero exponent (low degree / valuation), or None if zero series.

min_order()¶

Lowest power with nonzero coefficient, or None if zero series.

sift(m, j)¶

Extract arithmetic subsequence: g[i] = self[m*i + j].

to_dict()¶

Return a Python dict mapping power -> Fraction for nonzero coefficients.

truncation_order()¶

The truncation order N: series is known exactly for exponents < N.
